comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Fascination Nostalgia, and we'd love to have this added to the group! Invitation / Invitación / Einladung / Invito / Convite / Uitnodiging / Приглашение /招待 The photo is beautiful www.flickr.com/groups/fascination_nostalgia/

comment.author: 11625135@N07
comment._content: The child appears to be a bit agitated.  Very nice photo.

comment.author: 8822983@N08
comment._content: It's a tricky one, we vote for girl - although the socks and shoes suggest boy, when zoomed in there is a short dress with a wide belt with a fancy buckle and a buttoned pleat - we think a boy would have shorts at this age. Very cute all the same!

comment.author: 39299412@N06
comment._content: Interesting how much fashion has changed over the last century.....

comment.author: 39917335@N08
comment._content: Very interesting but I don´t understand the girl/boy actitude...

comment.author: 93616978@N00
comment._content: The child looks like a girl, but in a way the child has some boyish features as well.

comment.author: 12994101@N00
comment._content: i think it is a boy - the stance and the hat seem "masculine"

comment.author: 32465819@N05
comment._content: More than likely a boy ... considering his clothing ... and yes, during this era and at this age, a boy would still have worn a tunic suit or pleated dress with a slouched belt. There may be matching shorts under the tunic, not visable in the photograph, and more often than not it was a boy who would have worn this type of belt.

comment.author: 80506458@N00
comment._content: Boy, probably...but...doesn't it look like Shelly Winters?  (I'm sorry for calling a living person - at least in this photo - an 'it'.  Doesn't seem right.  But we don't know whether it was a boy or a girl.)

comment.author: 10129697@N08
comment._content:
I think it's a boy too, young boys were often dressed like this at the time this photo was taken.
Fashions have changed a lot over the years, at one time no woman would have been seen dead wearing trousers (pants to you in the US) these days they not only wear trousers but mens suits.
